channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Hardly anyone would have picked Carrick to be Man Utd boss - but now?
item.description: As Michael Carrick's perfect start at Manchester United continues, is he building a case for the job longer term?

item.title: Why Arsenal's wobble may not even matter - despite 'feeling pressure'
item.description: Arsenal's winless run may normally be cause for concern - but the stats suggest they are still in control of the Premier League title race.

item.title: 'Another unbelievable result' - but what's different about Man Utd now?
item.description: MOTD pundit Danny Murphy explains how Manchester United earned their impressive win at Premier League leaders Arsenal, and how he feels the Gunners will react.

item.title: 'Intoxicating title fight impossible to call as Hearts refuse to buckle'
item.description: Depleted Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts passed the latest test of their mettle in compelling draw with Celtic, writes Tom English.

item.title: Villa 'extraordinary' in first win at Newcastle since infamous 2005 trip
item.description: Aston Villa produce 'extraordinary' performance as they claim their first win at Newcastle since the infamous 2005 encounter

item.title: Liverpool's Robertson unlikely to move to Spurs
item.description: Liverpool left-back Andy Robertson looks set to remain at Anfield after the Reds decide they are currently unable to proceed with a deal to sell him to Tottenham.

item.title: 'They're engaged' - Rosenior continues positive start at Chelsea
item.description: Liam Rosenior has started well at Chelsea and it bodes well for the future amid ambitions to qualify for the Champions League.

item.title: Why can't Newcastle win without Guimaraes?
item.description: Newcastle United have yet to win a league game without Bruno Guimaraes since he made his debut for the club in 2022.

item.title: 'There's no magician' - can Palace stop the slide?
item.description: After a torrid few weeks with captain Marc Guehi sold, manager Oliver Glasner confirming he will leave and striker Jean-Philippe Mateta wanting a transfer, are Crystal Palace's struggles on the field inevitable?

item.title: Hearts 'rattle' Celtic - but did red card play 'massive part'?
item.description: Hearts and Celtic play out a thrilling draw in the Scottish Premiership title race. But did Hearts deserve to win? Or did a controversial red card cost Celtic?

item.title: How many points will it take to win Scottish Premiership?
item.description: BBC Scotland crunches the numbers behind a gripping three-way fight for the Scottish top-flight title.

item.title: 'Hunter' Rangers have 'big opportunity' in title race - Rohl
item.description: Danny Rohl is relishing Rangers' role as the "hunter" in the Scottish Premiership title race after delivering a "statement" victory to reduce Hearts' advantage at the top.

item.title: Cunha scores stunning late winner as Man Utd beat Arsenal
item.description: Two sensational second-half strikes give Manchester United a huge win that takes them above Chelsea and Liverpool into fourth.

item.title: Buendia scores screamer as Villa beat Newcastle
item.description: Emiliano Buendia and Ollie Watkins both score as high-flying Aston Villa end their long wait for a St James' Park victory against Newcastle United.

item.title: Estevao-inspired Chelsea beat Crystal Palace
item.description: Estevao Willian replaces the injured Cole Palmer to inspire Chelsea to a comfortable win over Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park.

item.title: Forest boost survival hopes after win at Brentford
item.description: Nottingham Forest gave their hopes of Premier League survival a major boost with a hard-fought win against Brentford at Gtech Community Stadium.

item.title: Totally unrealistic to win every game - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says his side were "not at their best today" but it is "totally unrealistic" to win every single game after his side lost 3-2 to Manchester United at the Emirates Stadium.

item.title: Man City keep tabs on Alexander-Arnold - Monday gossip
item.description: Manchester City are keeping tabs on Trent Alexander-Arnold, Liverpool get positive response after approaching Xabi Alonso, Chelsea recall Aaron Anselmino from Borussia Dortmund loan, plus more.

item.title: Man City 'got job done' - so is WSL title race over?
item.description: Manchester City capitalised on Chelsea's defeat to open up a nine-point lead at the top of the Women's Super League. Is the title race over?

item.title: Leicester sack Cifuentes after six months as boss
item.description: Marti Cifuentes is sacked as Leicester City manager after just six months in charge with the Foxes in the bottom half of the Championship.

item.title: So many positives to take - Carrick
item.description: Manchester United manager Michael Carrick says he is "so proud" of his side and there are "many positives to take" after they beat Mikel Arteta's Arsenal 3-2 at the Emirates Stadium.

item.title: Late Shaw goal sends Man City clear at top
item.description: A late goal from Women's Super League top scorer Khadija Shaw gives Manchester City victory against London City Lionesses, sending them nine points clear at the top.

item.title: Olme scores straight from corner in comfortable Man Utd win
item.description: Julia Zigiotti Olme scores straight from a corner to give Manchester United the lead at Aston Villa - and the visitors go on to win 4-1.

item.title: 'What a goal!' Lamal scores stunning volley
item.description: Lamine Yamal scores a stunning goal for Barcelona in La Liga to help complete a 3-0 victory over Real Oviedo at the Spotify Camp Nou.

item.title: Flamengo make new £35m offer for West Ham's Paqueta
item.description: Flamengo make a new offer of more than 41m euros (£35.5m) for West Ham and Brazil forward Lucas Paqueta.

item.title: Fulham make £28m bid to sign PSV forward Pepi
item.description: Fulham make a £28m bid to sign United States forward Ricardo Pepi from Dutch club PSV Eindhoven.

item.title: Why Carrick's Man Utd coaches are more than just 'a bunch of his mates'
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains the thinking behind Michael Carrick's backroom staff appointments at Manchester United, and what a manager wants from those roles.

item.title: Why mentality matters for Wrexham and their latest promotion bid
item.description: With a 'never count out Wrexham' mantra, the club's latest comeback victory puts Phil Parkinson's side firmly in the Championship promotion picture.

item.title: 'Joyless and toxic' - will Spurs put Frank out of his misery?
item.description: Tottenham manager Thomas Frank remains in deep trouble despite his side rescuing a late draw at Burnley, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: League Two Fleetwood sack head coach Wild
item.description: League Two side Fleetwood Town sack head coach Pete Wild and his assistant Adam Temple after a run of six defeats in seven matches.

item.title: Thirteen signings & £180m spent - have Forest got value for money?
item.description: Despite spending about £180m on summer signings Nottingham Forest are 17th in the Premier League - did they get value for money?

item.title: WSL title probably gone for Chelsea, says Bompastor
item.description: Sonia Bompastor claims the Women's Super League title is "probably gone" for Chelsea - BBC Sport examines whether that means they will shift their focus.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v 'Roy Keane' - Saipan star Hardwicke
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on actor Éanna Hardwicke, who plays Roy Keane in the new film Saipan - and AI - with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: From 'impossible task' to 'hope' - will West Ham stay up?
item.description: Back-to-back Premier League wins have taken West Ham United to within two points of 17th.

item.title: Boro set marker & Wrexham show play-off credentials - Sam Parkin's EFL takeaways
item.description: Final Score EFL pundit Sam Parkin reflects on the highs and lows after Saturday's action.

item.title: 'Liverpool's struggles can no longer be hidden by long unbeaten run'
item.description: Liverpool's struggles can no longer be hidden by their long unbeaten run after their last-gasp defeat at Bournemouth, writes Aadam Patel.

item.title: How well do you know Arsenal and Man Utd's rivalry?
item.description: It is a match that used to dominate title clashes with 16 Premier League trophies between the sides.

item.title: 'Saipan was not a jolly' - the infamous Keane v McCarthy row
item.description: Former Republic of Ireland keeper Dean Kiely reveals what happened during Roy Keane and Mick McCarthy's infamous row before the 2002 World Cup.

item.title: Six English clubs and old foes - all to play for on Champions League final day
item.description: With the league phase of Champions League almost over, which teams can join Arsenal and Bayern Munich in the top eight?

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Which countries haven't had a Premier League player?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore which countries have not been represented in the Premier League.

item.title: Which countries are set to win extra Champions League places?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains which countries are on course to win extra qualification spots for the 2026-27 Champions League campaign.

item.title: Can January signings play in the Champions League?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Antoine Semenyo and Conor Gallagher won't yet be able to play for their new clubs in the Champions League.

item.title: How much has Guardiola spent on defenders at Man City?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at how many defenders Manchester City have signed since Pep Guardiola arrived at the Etihad.

item.title: What is it like to be a caretaker manager?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what life is like as a caretaker boss after Michael Carrick's appointment at Manchester United, with Neil Warnock and Phil Brown detailing their experiences.

item.title: Who is Manchester City debutant Max Alleyne?
item.description: Manchester City defender Max Alleyne will make his Premier League debut on Wednesday after being named in Pep Guardiola's team to face Brighton.

item.title: What is the Women's Champions Cup and who will Arsenal play?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Fifa's new Women's Champions Cup.

item.title: Man charged over online abuse towards ex-Celtic chairman Peter Lawwell
item.description: Lawwell, 66, stood down from the role in December citing "abuse and threats from some sources".

item.title: Musiala set for Bayern return six months after leg break
item.description: Jamal Musiala is set to return to the Bayern Munich squad seven months after suffering a leg break at the Club World Cup.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: 162 arrests in Spain's violent ultras crackdown
item.description: Spanish police say they have "neutralised dozens of meet-ups" between violent ultra groups this season.

item.title: 'I know my role' - O'Sullivan on Liverpool challenge
item.description: It was an "emotional" decision by Denise O'Sullivan to leave North Carolina Courage but the challenge at Liverpool was an exciting one.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
